messages.title: Cuts in council budgets and services
messages.content: Lobby of Somerset County Council – Shire Hall 18.2.15 9.15am to 10.00am Lobby of Taunton Deane Borough Council – Deane House 24.2.15 5.30pm to 6.15pm

messages.title: A foolish strategy
messages.content: Our councils are choosing to follow a strategy of slashing and burning public services. They believe ultimately in the end of direct taxation and the removal of all services. They will not even make the 1.9% rise in Council Tax which the Coalition allows. Doing this year after year has been described as "compound interest in reverse" – ultimately it just increases the speed at which services are reduced or abolished.

messages.title: Fighting austerity
messages.content: "Austerity is not an economic necessity but a political choice, which has seen a tiny elite gain massively and everyone else suffer, with the poor suffering the most. The Green Party would restore our public services and bring in a decent social security system. We would tax the wealthiest 1% to pay for this. We are the sixth richest country in the world but we have reduced services, food banks in every town and city, and the super-rich laughing all the way to the bank"

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposition to the council's strategy of reducing public services and taxation, warning against the increased speed at which services are being reduced or abolished.
Criticism of austerity as a political choice that benefits the elite and harms the poor, with a promise to restore public services, implement a fair social security system, and tax the wealthiest 1%.

issues.economy: Criticism of austerity and its effects on the poverty and the reduction of public services.
issues.governance: Critique of the current council's strategy and taxation policy; opposition to service and budget cuts.
issues.socialWelfare: Promise to bring in a decent social security system; opposing cuts to public services.
